decks.notes: The deck revolves around controlling the game by countering spells, removing threats, and manipulating the opponent's resources. It aims to protect Dragonlord Ojutai, the commander, while generating card advantage through various draw spells and planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria. The deck also includes powerful interaction cards like Force of Will, Swords to Plowshares, and Mana Leak to disrupt the opponent's game plan. It utilizes a mix of permission spells, removal, and card draw to outvalue the opponent and establish dominance on the board. The mana base is carefully constructed to ensure consistent access to colored mana sources and efficient land drops throughout the game.

The focus of this deck is to control the game through a combination of counterspells, removal, and card advantage. Aminatou, the Fateshifter acts as the commander, providing additional value by flickering key permanents and setting up advantageous draws. The deck includes powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Teferi, Time Raveler to help control the board and provide card advantage. With a mix of efficient removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Fatal Push, along with versatile counterspells such as Force of Will and Counterspell, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up its own win conditions. Additionally, cards like Helm of Obedience and Moat provide unique win conditions that can catch opponents off guard.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through various forms of disruption, card advantage, and removal spells. By utilizing powerful control cards like Counterspell, Force of Will, and Thoughtseize, along with versatile threats like Baleful Strix and Snapcaster Mage, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and outvalue them in the long run. The inclusion of cards like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Jace, the Mind Sculptor provide additional card advantage and utility, while cards like Swords to Plowshares and Supreme Verdict help deal with opposing threats efficiently. Overall, the deck focuses on controlling the battlefield and the opponent's resources to secure victory in a 1 vs 1 format.

The deck focuses on aggressive creatures and disruptive elements to overwhelm the opponent quickly. Winota, Joiner of Forces is the commander, allowing you to cheat powerful creatures onto the battlefield when you attack with non-human creatures. The deck includes a mix of one-drop creatures, token generators, and disruptive spells like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Sanctum Prelate to slow down the opponent's game plan. With a strong mana base and cards like Lightning Bolt and Bonecrusher Giant for removal, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early and maintain that pressure throughout the game. By constantly threatening the opponent's life total and board state, the deck aims to secure a victory before the opponent can stabilize.

The deck focuses on a graveyard-based aggressive strategy with Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis as the commander. It utilizes a variety of creatures and spells that interact with the graveyard to generate value and pressure the opponent. The deck includes cards like Vengevine, Bloodghast, and Tarmogoyf to quickly fill the graveyard and put pressure on the opponent. It also includes cards like Survival of the Fittest and Fauna Shaman to tutor for key creatures. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with efficient threats and disrupt their game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Assassin's Trophy. Overall, the key concept of the deck is to leverage the graveyard as a resource to fuel an aggressive game plan while disrupting the opponent's strategy.

The deck is centered around leveraging the graveyard to maximize the value of creatures and spells, utilizing cards like Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis, Vengevine, and Bloodghast to apply consistent pressure on the opponent. The deck is packed with a variety of efficient ramp creatures like Birds of Paradise, Elvish Mystic, and Llanowar Elves to accelerate into its threats quickly. It also includes disruption like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and resilient aggro strategy, utilizing cards like Yavimaya, Cradle of Growth and The Great Henge to generate additional advantage and staying power in longer games.

This deck focuses on utilizing the powerful synergy between the partners Ikra Shidiqi and Tevesh Szat to apply relentless pressure on the opponent. The key strategy here is to control the board with a plethora of removal spells and disruption cards while gradually building up resources to overwhelm the opponent. The combination of efficient removal like Fatal Push and versatile threats like Skyclave Shade allows the deck to maintain a proactive game plan. Additionally, the inclusion of key utility lands such as Cabal Coffers and Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth ensures that the deck can generate significant mana advantage to deploy its threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan effectively.

The deck revolves around utilizing Karlov of the Ghost Council's ability to gain life and grow stronger, while also controlling the board and disrupting the opponent's strategy through targeted removal and hand disruption spells. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for additional recursion of low-cost permanents, providing extra value and flexibility in the game. The deck features a mix of protective spells, efficient creatures, and powerful enchantments to maintain board presence and pressure the opponent. The mana base is designed to support the deck's game plan and ensure consistent access to the necessary colors of mana.
